track.name: Spies
comments: too bad the Chinese can't hear such great music :(
I always think of James Bond when I hear this song.
my introduction to coldplay late one morning on vh1 insomniac channel, and still a classic.
this song is a real grower.
one of the best Coldplay tracks [2]
The music and the lyrics are incredible ! The paradox is making this song real artistic :)
one of the best tracks of Coldplay

I've never understood peoples beef with Coldplay's supposed "change" from Paracutes to the present. All their albums have been great, and it's all Coldplay when you listen to it. A Rush of Blood to the Head, X&Y, Viva la Vida, and especially Mylo Xyloto evoke the same Coldplay feel that Parachutes did for me. [3]

I've never understood peoples beef with Coldplay's supposed "change" from Paracutes to the present. All their albums have been great, and it's all Coldplay when you listen to it. A Rush of Blood to the Head, X&Y, Viva la Vida, and especially Mylo Xyloto evoke the same Coldplay feel that Parachutes did for me. [2]
@chiaroscuro3: You're absolutely right, but Paradise or that piece of shit Princess is like anything but Coldplay .
"I awake to see that no one is free"

"I've never understood peoples beef with Coldplay's supposed "change" from Parachutes to the present. All their albums have been great, and it's all Coldplay when you listen to it. A Rush of Blood to the Head, X&Y, Viva la Vida, and especially Mylo Xyloto evoke the same Coldplay feel that Parachutes did for me. In my opinion."


Thank you! This is exactly what I feel.
down here where i can not see so clear, i said what do i know, show me the right way to go.

I've never understood peoples beef with Coldplay's supposed "change" from Paracutes to the present. All their albums have been great, and it's all Coldplay when you listen to it. A Rush of Blood to the Head, X&Y, Viva la Vida, and especially Mylo Xyloto evoke the same Coldplay feel that Parachutes did for me. In my opinion.
